text: An anapsid is an amniote whose skull does not have openings on the sides behind the eyes.Pough F.H. et al. 2002. Vertebrate life, 6th ed. Prentice Hall, NJ. This is #A primitive ('basal') condition for early amniotes in the Mississippian (early Carboniferous). #A secondary ('derived') condition of some other reptile groups, probably including turtles (Chelonia). Some other groups were anapsids, such as the mesosaurs. == References == Category:Tetrapods
title: Anapsid
